Binance.title: Establishing Connection
items: Log in to your Binance account, hover over the account icon in the top-right corner, and select API Management from the dropdown menu.
Enter a name or label for your API key, then click Create API.
Click on Edit Restrictions and disable all permissions except Enable Reading (only Enable Reading should be selected).
Keep the IP access unrestricted.
Save your permissions, then copy your API Key and Secret Key here.
Click on Sync.

Binance.title: Spot File Upload
items: Log in to your Binance account.
Click on the profile image in the top-right menu.
Click on Orders.
Select Spot Orders.
Click on Trade History.
Click on the Export Recent Trade History button located in the top-right.
Select your desired time range.
Choose Excel as the export format.
Click on Export.

Binance.title: Futures File Upload
items: Log in to your Binance account.
Click on the profile image in the top-right menu.
Click on Orders.
Select Futures Orders.
Click on Trade History.
Click on the Export button located in the top-right.
Select your desired time range.
Click on Export.

Coinbase.title: Establishing Connection
items: Log in to your Coinbase account. On the left, click on the API button in the side menu.

For Spot trading: On the right, click Create API Key. Name your API key and leave the portfolio as Default. Ensure only the View (read-only) permission is checked. Do not add an IP whitelist. Click Create & Download.

For Futures trading: On the right, click Create API Key. Name your API key and change the portfolio to Perpetuals. Ensure only the View (read-only) permission is checked. Do not add an IP whitelist. Click Create & Download.
Copy your API Key and API Secret here.
Click on Sync.

Coinbase.title: File Upload
items: Log in to your Coinbase account.
On the left side menu, click on the Orders button.
In the Orders tab, click on the Visit Statements button on the right side.
On the Statements page, leave the options as All assets and All transactions. Choose your desired Date range and select CSV format.
Generate the file. It will download automatically.
Upload the downloaded file here.

Bybit.title: Establishing Connection
items: Log in to your Bybit account, then click on the profile button in the top-right corner and select API from the dropdown menu.
Click on Create New Key, then choose System-generate API Key.
Set a name for your key and select Read-Only.
Check the Unified Trading option.
Ensure that Orders, Positions, USDC Derivatives Trading, and Trade are all checked under the Read-Only permissions.
Click Submit.
Copy your API Key and Secret Key here.
Click on Sync.

Bybit.title: Spot File Upload
items: Log in to your Bybit account.
In the top-right corner, click on the Orders menu.
From the dropdown, select Unified Trading Center.
Click on Spot Orders.
Choose the Trade History tab.
Click on the Export button located in the top-right.
Adjust the date range if needed.
Click on the Export Now button.
Upload the exported file here.

Bybit.title: Futures File Upload
items: Log in to your Bybit account.
In the top-right corner, click on the Orders menu.
From the dropdown, select Unified Trading Center.
Click on either USDT Perpetual or USDC Perpetual.
Choose the Trade History tab.
Click on the Export button located in the top-right.
Adjust the date range if needed.
Click on the Export Now button.
Upload the exported file here.

Crypto.com.title: Establishing Connection
items: Log in to your Crypto.com account, then click on the profile button in the top-right corner and select your email.
On the left side of the screen, scroll down and click on Settings, then select API Keys.
Click on Create a new API key, enter a label, and in the API restrictions, ensure that only Can Read is checked.
Copy your API Key and Secret Key here.
Click on Sync.

Crypto.com.title: File Upload
items: Log in to your Crypto.com account.
On the exchange homepage, click on the Wallet button in the top-right corner.
On the left side, open the Orders menu.
Go to the Trade History tab, adjust the date range as needed, and leave the other options as they are.
Export the data to CSV.
Upload the exported file here.

Kraken.title: Establishing Connection
items: Log in to your Kraken account, click on the profile button in the top-right corner, then go to Settings and select API.

For Spot trading: Under Spot Trading API, click Create API key. Then, in the Orders and trades tab, select only the Query open orders & trades and Query closed orders & trades radio buttons. Click Generate API.
For Futures trading: Under Futures Trading API, click Create API key. Then, in the General API tab, select Read Only, and in the Withdrawal API section, select No access. Click Generate API.
Copy your API Key and Secret Key here.
Click on Sync.

Kraken.title: Spot File Upload
items: Log in to your Kraken account.
In the top-right corner, click on your profile picture button and select Documents.
Select the Documents tab and click the Create export button.
From the dropdown, select Trades, choose your time period, and check Select All from the field checkbox.
Ensure 'Trades' is selected from the dropdown and not 'Ledgers'.
Set the Format to CSV.
Click on Generate, wait a few seconds, and in the Exports section, download your file.
Unzip the file and upload the CSV file here.

Kraken.title: Futures File Upload
items: Log in to your Kraken account.
In the top-right corner, click on your profile picture button and select Documents.
Select the Documents tab and click the Create export button.
From the dropdown, select Ledger, then choose Futures.
Ensure 'Ledger' is selected from the dropdown.
Set the Format to CSV.
Click on Generate, wait a few seconds, and download your file.
Unzip the file and upload the CSV file here.

KuCoin.title: Establishing Connection
items: Log in to your KuCoin account, click on the profile button in the top-right corner, hover over it, and select API Management.
Click on Create API, enter a name for your API and your API passphrase. Under API Restriction, ensure General (Read-only) is selected. Click Next and then Create.
Copy your API Key and Secret Key here.
Click on Sync.

KuCoin.title: Spot File Upload
items: Log in to your KuCoin account.
In the top-right menu, click on Orders and select Spot Trade History.
Click on the Trade History tab.
Choose a time period from the dropdown and click on Save as CSV.
Confirm the export.
Wait for the CSV to be generated.
Click on the Download button.
Upload the CSV file here.

KuCoin.title: Futures File Upload
items: Log in to your KuCoin account.
In the top-right menu, click on Futures Orders.
Click on the Trade History tab.
In the upper-right corner, click on Export.
Under Market Futures Orders, select the Filled Orders radio button.
Choose the desired time period range.
Set the Time Zone to UTC-0 (Europe/Greenwich).
Select CSV as the file type.
Click on Confirm to export.
Once the file is generated, download it.
Upload the CSV file here.

OKX.title: Establishing Connection
items: Log in to your OKX account, click on the profile button in the top-right corner, hover over it, and select API.
Click on Create APIs, enter a name for your API, and under Permission, select only READ.
Fill in a passphrase and generate the API key.
Copy your API Key and Secret Key here.
Click on Sync.

OKX.title: File Upload
items: Log in to your OKX account.
Go to the homepage and click on the Assets dropdown in the top-right corner.
From the dropdown, select Order Center.
Open the Trading History tab.
Click on the Download button located in the top-right.
Select your desired date range.
Set the Time zone to UTC+0 (important).
Click on the Export button and wait for the download link.
Upload the exported file here.
